post: This is the last week to donate through the Combined Federal Campaign for federal employees and retirees! Read the article below, to find out more.

Federal Employees & Retirees! Time is running out to make a difference ! Support the Bill of Rights Institute through the Combined Federal Campaign (CFC) and help us provide free, high-quality civic education resources to students and teachers nationwide. Give Knowledge this season and GIVE HAPPY using CFC code 36265.

Jan. 15 is the final day to make your pledge through the CFC. If you havent already pledged, start your new year off with a gift that will keep on giving all year long – a recurring payroll deduction – and GIVE HAPPY to one or more charities that you care about at GiveCFC.org. Just $5 per paycheck can have a huge impact!  #GiveCFC

How did BRI's professional development programs help an educator teaching English as a Second Language? BRIs Teacher Fellowship allowed Bridget Jordan to deepen her understanding of civics and civic education while also thinking of innovative ways for her students to achieve their goals. After meeting with other BRI Teacher Fellows, Jordan said she not only [grew] as a teacher but also contributed to a community of educators dedicated to promoting civic literacy and engagement.  Read more:  https://lnkd.in/efd9PJwN.
Happy New Year from the Bill of Rights Institute! As we enter into a new year, let's reflect on the principles that built our nationfreedom, equality, and self-governance.

President Abraham Lincoln finalized plans for the Emancipation Proclamation  #OTD in 1862, a transformative document that would take effect on January 1, 1863, altering the course of American history by declaring freedom for enslaved people in Confederate states.
